text: Hi <@ULBP4M3LK>, I'm new to HubSpot CMS but I think what you're looking for can be found in Settings > Website > Pages > Templates where you can "Add custom code snippets to the HTML head section across all of your pages". Hope that helps!

Hey everyone, experienced Wordpress developer here but new to HubSpot CMS, learning how to use it to support an existing website for a new client. Any useful beginner tips? Currently going through the HubSpot Academy to get familar with the basics.

Can’t use column gaps though
I avoid CSS grid for now and just use flex
Actually yes you can use gaps autoprefixer converts them into columns for ie users and moves the grid children automatically. Its honestly awesome

Does it use this kind of method?
<https://css-tricks.com/css-grid-in-ie-faking-an-auto-placement-grid-with-gaps/>
No, it uses the ie prefixes for the old spec for grid. So ie users do see it in grid form. your original nonprefixed code is a progressive enhancement for browsers that can read it like edge
So you're not faking a grid with flex
That’s pretty cool, still waiting for IE to die so I don’t have to worry about all this!
Once chromium edge hits stable :internet-exploder: should die within a few months of it
I do hope so! I’ve got my beta’s installed in anticipation!

I dunno about it dying. I feel like anything in the B2B market is just going to be stuck with it for the next 5 years until they finally do the mass upgrades on the computers and it just.... isn't there anymore
well, the reason is the new chromium edge
so for IT teams it's a no brainer to switch because it gives them more control, better security, and they can designate sites that are ancient to use IE mode
Also the statement from an exec "Internet explorer is not a web browser it is a compatibility tool" was a pretty strong signal
We shall see Mr. Mclaren....we shall see. In the meantime, I like your optimism!
haha, I'm usually optimistic about a lot of things, I know better not to be when it comes to IE. I think the web's about to get a lot better :slightly_smiling_face:
